title: Transferring a plot of land belonging to the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation to the Ceylon Electricity Board for the construction of the proposed grid substation at Ekala
decision_details: - According to the high demand for electricity in Ekala and its surrounding areas, it has been proposed to build a grid substation in the Ekala industrial park with the aim of supplying electricity continuously as well as increasing the quality of the existing electricity system. It has been recognized that it is appropriate to construct the said grid substation by using a land portion of 02 acres and 02 roods from the 10 acres of land owned by the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, which is located adjacent to Ekala Sandcrop Estate. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security and Mass Media to vest the said land with the Ceylon Electricity Board, having received Rs.320 million, the value which is the assessed by the Chief Government Valuer, was approved by the Cabinet.
